senses.sense_definition: A person or organization that appeals a court decision to a higher court to have it reversed or modified.

examples.text: The <w>appellant</w> argued that the evidence had been mishandled during the original trial.
The judge ruled in favor of the <w>appellant</w> and ordered a new hearing.

senses.sense_definition: A person who makes a serious or urgent request or plea.

examples.text: The king listened patiently to the <w>appellant</w> seeking mercy for his family.
As a humble <w>appellant</w>, he stood before the committee to plead his case.

senses.sense_definition: A person who challenges another to a duel or single combat.

examples.text: The <w>appellant</w> threw down his gauntlet to initiate the duel.
In medieval times, the <w>appellant</w> had to prove his accusation through combat.

senses.sense_definition: A member of the clergy in the 18th century who rejected the papal bull Unigenitus.

examples.text: The <w>appellant</w> refused to accept the new decree from the pope.
Historians study the letters written by an <w>appellant</w> during the religious controversy.

senses.sense_definition: Relating to the power or authority to review court decisions and change them.

examples.text: The judge exercised <w>appellant</w> jurisdiction over the complex case.
They submitted the documents for <w>appellant</w> review before the deadline.

senses.sense_definition: In the process of making an appeal or challenge.

examples.text: He came <w>appellant</w> to the throne to seek justice for his people.
The knight stood <w>appellant</w> before his accusers, ready to defend his honor.
